title: An unnecessary famine
creator_credit: Yorkshire Television, Chris Bryer, Peter Gordon and Ian McFarlane
brief_description: Using Sudan as an example, shows that the causes of hunger in developing nations are both natural and political. Considers the roles of the World Bank and the major economic powers in this situation
creator_credit_for_label: Yorkshire Television, Chris Bryer, Peter Gordon and Ian McFarlane
